reviewText:
I rarely see a WW2 flight simulator game in nowadays, so I'm really happy to see one, where you don't have to play 400 hours to fly with a Me-163.
But my satisfaction is not complete. As you see this game use an old game engine, so the grapics is outdated as hell, and I also doubt this game have the best handling,
but we have to understand it's an indie game not an AAA game, so our expectation have to adjust to the 17-19$ price range. However it's not a bad game, and this games strongest side is the massive air battle with hundreds airplane. Just check the video below, you will understand it and I also think it will help you decide if you are thinking on to buy it.:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y76CtF-tu8I

reviewText:
I will write a longer review soon, but for now I wanted to recommend the game because the mostly negative rating makes this look like a terrible game, which it is not. I'll go in detail when I get some free time. However, if you like team play flight sims... THE ONLINE WORLD WAR MAP IS HUGE!!!!

I wrote my more detailed review here for those that are interested in the game and the features it has to offer:
http://blogjob.com/oneangrygamer/2016/01/warbirds-dogfights-2016-review/

reviewText: Hate it. Spit totally uncontrollable, likes diving into the ground. I can fly the Spit Mk 1 in FSX to stall and spin and I can still recover. This game is a waste of money.
